intro: Psychotria leucococca, commonly known as the white-eyed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria leucococca is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
